str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To reproach, revile, upbraid. From oneidos; to defame, i.e. Rail at, chide, taunt.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and pauo; to repose (be exempt), remain); by implication, to refresh.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
